alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 28 at 1:59PM MST until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. .A warm, windy, and moist storm system will impact the region over the next 24-36 hours. Heavy rain will continue to fall into Tuesday. Temperatures will warm above freezing and remain mild into Wednesday increasing snowmelt. The combination of heavy rain and snowmelt will result in excess runoff and potential for rivers to rise quickly, some which could reach minor flood stage this week. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...flooding is possible. For the St Joe River at St Maries...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PST Monday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM PST.
